title: Luis Alberto (footballer, born 1943)
text:
Luis Alberto is a former Argentinian <a href="association%20football">football</a> player.
In 1978, Alberto signed with the <a href="New%20York%20Arrows">New York Arrows</a> of the <a href="MISL%20I">Major Indoor Soccer League</a>. He won three MISL championships with the Arrows. In 1979, he played on loan to the <a href="Rochester%20Lancers%20%281967%E2%80%9380%29">Rochester Lancers</a> of the <a href="North%20American%20Soccer%20League%20%281968-1984%29">North American Soccer League</a>. On February 10, 1982, the Arrows sold Alberto's contract to the <a href="Cleveland%20Force%20%281978%E2%80%931988%29">Cleveland Force</a>. On May 19, 1983, the force traded him to the <a href="Pittsburgh%20Spirit">Pittsburgh Spirit</a> in exchange for <a href="Krys%20Sobieski">Krys Sobieski</a>. On January 4, 1985, he signed with the <a href="New%20York%20Cosmos%20%281971%E2%80%931985%29">New York Cosmos</a>, now playing in the MISL. The Cosmos withdrew from the league in February 1985 and released Alberto. In March, he signed with the <a href="Wichita%20Wings">Wichita Wings</a> and finished the season there. In 1986, Alberto returned to New York to join the expansion <a href="New%20York%20Express">New York Express</a> which collapsed two-thirds of the way through the season.
